items.title: Nvidia, with $3.34 Trillion Market Cap, Becomes Most Valuable Company
items.content_html: The chip maker’s stock price has jumped over the last year thanks to its stranglehold on the market for the chips needed to build A.I. systems.
items.summary: The chip maker’s stock price has jumped over the last year thanks to its stranglehold on the market for the chips needed to build A.I. systems.

items.title: How Crypto Money Is Poised to Influence the Election
items.content_html: The industry’s political awakening — and enormous pool of cash — is already affecting high-profile races across the country.
items.summary: The industry’s political awakening — and enormous pool of cash — is already affecting high-profile races across the country.

author.name: David Yaffe-Bellany, Erin Griffith and Theodore Schleifer

items.title: FTC Sues Adobe Over Hard-to-Cancel Subscriptions and Fees
items.content_html: The maker of Photoshop and other popular design software hid details of expensive cancellation fees, according to a Justice Department lawsuit.
items.summary: The maker of Photoshop and other popular design software hid details of expensive cancellation fees, according to a Justice Department lawsuit.

items.title: How A.I. Is Revolutionizing Drug Development
items.content_html: In high-tech labs, workers are generating data to train A.I. algorithms to design better medicine, faster. But the transformation is just getting underway.
items.summary: In high-tech labs, workers are generating data to train A.I. algorithms to design better medicine, faster. But the transformation is just getting underway.

items.title: CDK Global Cyberattack Disrupts Car Sales in U.S. and Canada
items.content_html: The attacks on a software provider, CDK Global, affect systems that store customer records and automate paperwork and data for sales and service.
items.summary: The attacks on a software provider, CDK Global, affect systems that store customer records and automate paperwork and data for sales and service.

items.title: 260 McNuggets? McDonald’s Ends A.I. Drive-Through Tests Amid Errors
items.content_html: Ordering mistakes frustrated customers during nearly three years of tests. But competitors like White Castle and Wendy’s say their A.I. ordering systems have been highly accurate.
items.summary: Ordering mistakes frustrated customers during nearly three years of tests. But competitors like White Castle and Wendy’s say their A.I. ordering systems have been highly accurate.

items.summary: Will a social media warning really help children’s mental health?

items.title: TikTok Lays Out Past Efforts to Address U.S. Concerns Over Potential Ban
items.content_html: The company said the disclosures support its argument that a law signed by President Biden in May is unconstitutional.
items.summary: The company said the disclosures support its argument that a law signed by President Biden in May is unconstitutional.

items.title: Ilya Sutskever, OpenAI Co-Founder Who Helped Oust Sam Altman, Starts His Own Company
items.content_html: Ilya Sutskever’s new start-up, Safe Superintelligence, aims to build A.I. technologies that are smarter than a human but not dangerous.
items.summary: Ilya Sutskever’s new start-up, Safe Superintelligence, aims to build A.I. technologies that are smarter than a human but not dangerous.

items.title: On Titan Submersible Anniversary, World Rethinks Deep Sea Exploration
items.content_html: A year after the first deaths of divers who ventured into the ocean’s sunless depths, an industry wrestles with new challenges for piloted submersibles and robotic explorers.
items.summary: A year after the first deaths of divers who ventured into the ocean’s sunless depths, an industry wrestles with new challenges for piloted submersibles and robotic explorers.

items.title: How the Teamsters and a Homegrown Union Plan to Take On Amazon
items.content_html: An affiliation agreement between the Amazon Labor Union and the 1.3 million-member Teamsters signals an escalation in challenging the online retailer.
items.summary: An affiliation agreement between the Amazon Labor Union and the 1.3 million-member Teamsters signals an escalation in challenging the online retailer.

items.title: Can A.I. Answer the Needs of Smaller Businesses? Some Push to Find Out.
items.content_html: Artificial intelligence tools like ChatGPT are finding widest use at big companies, but there is wide expectation that the impact will spread.
items.summary: Artificial intelligence tools like ChatGPT are finding widest use at big companies, but there is wide expectation that the impact will spread.

items.title: Lynn Conway, Computing Pioneer and Transgender Advocate, Dies at 86
items.content_html: She made significant contributions at IBM, but she lost her job because of her conviction that she inhabited the wrong body. She later fought for transgender rights.
items.summary: She made significant contributions at IBM, but she lost her job because of her conviction that she inhabited the wrong body. She later fought for transgender rights.

items.title: Elon Musk Got 72% in Tesla Shareholder Vote on Pay
items.content_html: About 72 percent of shares in the balloting affirmed the chief executive’s lucrative stock award. The company hopes to get a court to reinstate it.
items.summary: About 72 percent of shares in the balloting affirmed the chief executive’s lucrative stock award. The company hopes to get a court to reinstate it.

items.title: Apple Joins the A.I. Party, Elon’s Wild Week and HatGPT

items.title: Remo Saraceni, 89, Dies; Inventor of the Walking Piano Seen in ‘Big’
items.content_html: His keyboard, which became famous after Tom Hanks melodiously hopped on it, displayed Mr. Saraceni’s vision of technology powered by “people energy.”
items.summary: His keyboard, which became famous after Tom Hanks melodiously hopped on it, displayed Mr. Saraceni’s vision of technology powered by “people energy.”

items.title: Clearview AI Used Your Face. Now You May Get a Stake in the Company.
items.content_html: The facial recognition start-up doesn’t have the funds to settle a class-action lawsuit, so lawyers are proposing equity for those whose faces were scraped from the internet.
items.summary: The facial recognition start-up doesn’t have the funds to settle a class-action lawsuit, so lawyers are proposing equity for those whose faces were scraped from the internet.

items.title: Musk’s Friends and Fans Applaud Shareholder Vote on His Payday

items.summary: On the social media platform X, which Mr. Musk owns, reactions to a vote that reaffirmed Mr. Musk’s $45 billion package were buoyant.

items.title: X CEO Linda Yaccarino Touts Advertiser Return After Musk Takeover

items.title: Tesla Shareholders Approve C.E.O. Elon Musk’s Pay Package
